sen.j: 日本海軍の歴史は中世初期のアジア大陸との関わりまでさかのぼる。
sen.e: History of Japanese navy can be traced back to the relation with Asian Continent in early medieval period.
The history of Japanese navy goes back to the early medieval period in which Japan interacted with countries on the Asian Continent.
sen.cmt: 「関わり」の訳が単数になっています。
sen.e: The history of Japanese navy goes back to the early medieval period in which Japan interacted with countries on the Asian Continent.

sen.j: その活動は16世紀から17世紀にかけての南蛮貿易によるヨーロッパ諸国との貿易で頂点に達する。
sen.e: Its activities reached the peak in the trade with European countries in 16th and 17th centuries
Its activities reached the peak in the trade with European countries in 16th and 17th centuries
Its activities reached the peak in the trade with European countries in 16th and 17th centuries

sen.j: 江戸時代の鎖国によってその技術は西洋に比べて見劣りするようになった。
sen.e: Due to the isolation policy in Edo era, Japanese art got inferior to that of Europe
Japan's naval technologies, however, came to lag behind those of European countries because of the isolation policy taken during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「技術」の訳は「art]として用語集のデータベースに登録されておりますが、カテゴリは「伝統文化」です。
sen.e: Japan's naval technologies, however, came to lag behind those of European countries because of the isolation policy taken during the Edo period.

sen.j: 黒船来襲の時その差は決定的となり、その後の明治維新に繋がる。
sen.e: When Kurofune (the Black ships of Comodore Matthew Perry) came to Japan, the difference of arts between Japan and the West had come to the decisive stage and the difference led to Meiji Reatoration.

Japan's being far behind the naval technologies of the West was glaringly clear to everyone to see when Kurofune (the Black ships of Commodore Matthew Perry) came to Japan and this fact led Japan to the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 前列の場合と同様に「arts」の使用に違和感を覚えます。
sen.e: Japan's being far behind the naval technologies of the West was glaringly clear to everyone to see when Kurofune (the Black ships of Commodore Matthew Perry) came to Japan and this fact led Japan to the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 近代化と工業化を急いだ結果1920年(大正9年)には帝国海軍は世界第三位になった。
sen.e: As the result that Japan made efforts in modernization and industrialization in a hurry, Japanese Imperial Navy reached the third place in the world.
As a result of having hurried the modernization and industrialization of Japan, the Imperial Japanese Navy became the third largest navy in the world in 1920.
As a result of having hurried the modernization and industrialization of Japan, the Imperial Japanese Navy became the third largest navy in the world in 1920.

sen.j: 帝国海軍の大規模戦役の歴史は、1895年(明治28年)の日清戦争に始り、1905年(明治38年)の日露戦争ではほぼ完全勝利したが、大東亜戦争（太平洋戦争）で米国海軍と戦い、艦隊戦力は壊滅状態となり、その後公式に消滅した。
sen.e: The history of Imperial Navy in the big military campaign began in the Shino-Japanese War in 1895, and the Imperial Navy won a perfect victory in the Russo-Japanese War, but in the Pacific War it fought with U.S. navy and its fleet was totally destroyed, afterwards ceased to exist.

The history of the large-scale military campaigns of the Imperial Navy began with the 1895 Sino-Japanese War and the 1905 Russo-Japanese War ended with the Imperial Navy's near perfect victory; however, in the Great East Asian War (the Pacific War) the fighting power of the fleets of the Imperial Navy was almost completely annihilated by the United States Navy and the Imperial Navy was officially dissolved at the end of the war.
sen.cmt: 「ほぼ完全」が訳されていません。
sen.e: The history of the large-scale military campaigns of the Imperial Navy began with the 1895 Sino-Japanese War and the 1905 Russo-Japanese War ended with the Imperial Navy's near perfect victory; however, in the Great East Asian War (the Pacific War) the fighting power of the fleets of the Imperial Navy was almost completely annihilated by the United States Navy and the Imperial Navy was officially dissolved at the end of the war.

sen.j: 日本の現代海軍は自衛隊の傘下の海上自衛隊である。
sen.e: Japanese navy in the modern age is Maritime Self-Defense Force under Japan Self-Defense Force wing,
Japan's current navy falls under the umbrella of the Japan Self-Defense Forces as the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.
sen.cmt: 「現代」の訳は、「modern age」として用語集に登録されていますが、この文の場合は、「current」という意味でないと前の文とうまくつながりません。
sen.e: Japan's current navy falls under the umbrella of the Japan Self-Defense Forces as the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force.

sen.j: 予算の面では世界のトップクラスの海軍であるが、攻撃的な役割の多くは失った。
sen.e: In the budget Maritime Self-Defense Force is the top class navy in the world, but it has lost many parts for aggression.
In terms of budget, it is one of the top navies in the world; however, it is denied of many offensive roles.
sen.cmt: 「役割」が訳されておりません。
sen.e: In terms of budget, it is one of the top navies in the world; however, it is denied of many offensive roles.

sen.j: － 8世紀から11世紀半まで、断続的に続いた。
sen.e: -It lasted from the 8th century to the 11th century intermittently.
-It lasted from the 8th century to the 11th century intermittently.
-It lasted from the 8th century to the 11th century intermittently.
